availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas C. Todd (Hopkins County, KY, farmer, pvt 4th Ky Mtd Inf (csa))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Todd and Eveline Todd. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 14, 1861 to January 14, 1864. Reported as deserted at Dalton, Georgia, in January 1864. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 59B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 164-65.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, June 1864, p. 157.
